maml:description.maml:para: Lists intelligence packs and whether they're enabled for a workspace.
The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsIntelligencePacks cmdlet lists all intelligence packs and whether they are enabled or disabled for a workspace.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, operational, insights

maml:description.maml:para: Gets accounts that are not associated with a subscription.

The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsLinkTargets cmdlet lists existing accounts that are not associated with an Azure subscription. To link a new workspace to an existing account, use a customer ID returned by this operation in the customer ID property of a new workspace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get unlinked accounts

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets unlinked accounts that are owned by the caller's ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a storage insight.

The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsStorageInsight cmdlet gets information about an existing storage insight. If a storage insight name is specified, this cmdlet gets information about that Storage Insight. If you do not specify a name, this cmdlet gets information about all storage insights in a workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace that contains the storage insight(s).
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the workspace that contains the storage insight(s).
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the workspace that contains the storage insight(s).
Specifies the name of the workspace that contains the storage insight(s).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a storage insight by name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the storage insight named MyStorageInsight from the workspace named ContosoWorkspace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a storage insight by using a workspace object

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet to get an Operational Insights workspace, and then stores it in the $Workspace variable.
The second command gets the storage insight named MyStorageInsight for the workspace in $Workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets details of management groups connected to a workspace.
The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspaceManagementGroups cmdlet lists the management groups that are connected to a workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get management groups by workspace name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the management groups for the workspace named MyWorkspace in the resource group named ContosoResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get management groups by using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet to get the workspace named MyWorkspace, and then passes the workspace to the current cmdlet, which gets the management groups for that workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the shared keys for a workspace.
The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspaceSharedKeys cmdlet lists the shared keys for a workspace. The keys are used to connect Operational Insights agents to the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get shared keys by workspace name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the shared keys for the workspace named Myworkspace in the resource group named ContosoResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get shared keys by using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the workspace named MyWorkspace using the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet, and then passes the workspace to the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspaceSharedKeys cmdlet. The command gets the shared keys for that workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the usage data for a workspace.
The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspaceUsage cmdlet retrieves the usage data for a workspace. This exposes how much data has been analyzed by the workspace over a certain period.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get usage data by workspace name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the usage details for the workspace named MyWorkspace in the specified resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get usage data using the pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the workspace named MyWorkSpace using the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet, and then passes the workspace to the current cmdlet. The command gets the usage details for that workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a workspace.

The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet gets information about an existing workspace. If you specify a workspace name, this cmdlet gets information about that workspace. If you do not specify a name, this cmdlet gets information about all workspaces in a resource group. If you do not specify a name and resource group, this cmdlet gets information about all workspaces in a subscription.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a workspace by name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a workspace named MyWorkspace in the resource group named ContosoResourceGroup.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a storage insight inside a workspace.
The New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsStorageInsight cmdlet creates a new storage insight in an existing workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group that contains a workspace.
Specifies the name of an existing workspace.
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the Azure resource of a storage account. This can be retrieved by executing the Get-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet and accessing the Id parameter of the result.
Specifies the access key for the storage account.
Specifies the list of tables that provide the data.
Specifies the list of containers that contain the data.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the workspace for the new storage insight.
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the Azure resource of a storage account. This can be retrieved by executing the Get-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet and accessing the Id parameter of the result.
Specifies the access key for the storage account.
Specifies the list of tables that provide the data.
Specifies the list of containers that contain the data.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the list of containers that contain the data.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group that contains a workspace.
Specifies the access key for the storage account.
Specifies the Azure resource of a storage account. This can be retrieved by executing the Get-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet and accessing the Id parameter of the result.
Specifies the list of tables that provide the data.
Specifies the workspace for the new storage insight.
Specifies the name of an existing workspace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a storage insight by name
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>$Storage = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount –ResourceGroupName "ContosoResourceGroup" –Name "ContosoStorage"
PS C:\>$StorageKey = ($Storage | Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey).Key1
PS C:\>New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsStorageInsight –ResourceGroupName "ContosoResourceGroup" –WorkspaceName "MyWorkspace" –Name "MyStorageInsight" –StorageAccountResourceId $Storage.Id –StorageAccountKey $StorageKey –Tables @("WADWindowsEventLogsTable")

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet to get the storage account named ContosoStorage, and then stores it in the $Storage variable.
The second command passes the storage account in $Storage to the Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey cmdlet to get the specified storage account key, and then stores it in the $StorageKey variable.

The final command creates a storage insight named MyStorageInsight in the workspace named MyWorkspace. This storage insight consumes data from the WADWindowsEventLogsTable table in the specified storage account resource.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a storage insight by using a workspace object
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>$Workspace = Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace –ResourceGroupName "ContosoResourceGroup" –Name "MyWorkspace"
PS C:\>$Storage = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount –ResourceGroupName "ContosoResourceGroup" –Name "ContosoStorage"
PS C:\>$StorageKey = ($Storage | Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey).Key1
PS C:\>New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsStorageInsight –Workspace $Workspace –Name "MyStorageInsight" –StorageAccountResourceId $Storage.Id –StorageAccountKey $StorageKey –Tables @("WADWindowsEventLogsTable")

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet to get the workspace named MyWorkspace, and then stores it in the $Workspace variable.
The second command uses the Get-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet to get the specified storage account, and then stores it in the $Storage variable.
The third command passes the storage account in $Storage to the Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey cmdlet to get the specified key, and then stores it in the $StorageKey variable.

The final command creates a storage insight named MyStorageInsight in the workspace defined in $Workspace. The storage insight consumes data from the WADWindowsEventLogsTable table in the specified storage account resource.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a workspace.
The New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet creates a workspace in the specified resource group and location.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group. The workspace will be created in this resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the location in which to create the workspace such as, "East US" or "West Europe."
Specifies the service tier of the workspace. Valid values are: -- free -- standard -- premium
Specifies the account to which this workspace will be linked. The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsLinkTargets cmdlet can also be used to list the potential accounts.
Specifies the resource tags for the workspace.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the account to which this workspace will be linked. The Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsLinkTargets cmdlet can also be used to list the potential accounts.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the location in which to create the workspace such as, "East US" or "West Europe."
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group. The workspace will be created in this resource group.
Specifies the service tier of the workspace. Valid values are: -- free -- standard -- premium
Specifies the resource tags for the workspace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a workspace by name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a standard SKU workspace named MyWorkspace in the resource group named ContosoResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a workspace and link it to an existing account
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>$OILinkTargets = Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsLinkTargets
PS C:\>$OILinkTargets[0] | New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace –ResourceGroupName "ContosoResourceGroup" -Name "MyWorkspace" –Sku "Standard"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsLinkTargets cmdlet to get Operational Insights account link targets, and then stores them in the $OILinkTargets variable.

The second command passes the first account link target in $OILinkTargets to the New-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet. The command creates a standard SKU workspace named MyWorkspace that is linked to the first Operational Insights account in $OILinkTargets.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a storage insight.
The Remove-AzureRmOperationalInsightsStorageInsight cmdlet deletes a storage insight from a workspace.

Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the storage insight.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

Specifies the name of the workspace that contains the storage insight.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a storage insight by name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the storage insight named MyStorageInsight from the workspace named MyWorkspace in the specified resource group. The command does not specify the Force parameter, so it prompts you for confirmation before removing the storage insight.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a storage insight without confirmation

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet to get the workspace named MyWorkspace, and then stores it in the $Workspace variable.The second command removes the storage insight named MyStorageInsight from $Workspace without prompting you for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a workspace.

The Remove-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet deletes an existing workspace. If this workspace was linked to an existing account via the CustomerId parameter at creation time the original account will not be deleted in the Operational Insights portal.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the workspace.
Specifies the name of an Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a workspace by name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the workspace named MyWorkspace from the resource group named ContosoResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a workspace by using the pipeline and without confirmation

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the Get-AzureRmOperationalInsightsWorkspace cmdlet to get the workspace named MyWorkspace, and then passes it to the current cmdlet to remove it. Since the Force parameter is specified, the command does not prompt you before removing the workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables or disables a given intelligence pack.
The Set-AzureRmOperationalInsightsIntelligencePack cmdlet sets an intelligence pack as enabled or disabled.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, operational, insights
